overview:
Bob Richards is the Co-Founder of International Space University, Singularity University and Google Lunar X PRIZE competitors Odyssey Moon and Moon Express, where he currently serves as CEO. Bob Directed the Optech Space Division from 2002-2009, providing key technology to the 2007 NASA Phoenix Mars Mission.

Bob studied aerospace and industrial engineering at Ryerson University; physics and astronomy at the University of Toronto; and space science at Cornell University, where he became special assistant to Carl Sagan. In 2008 Bob joined Peter Diamandis, Ray Kurweil and other leading thinkers in the founding of Singularity University, dedicated to preparing humanity for accelerating technological change.

Bob is an evangelist of the “NewSpace” movement and has been a catalyst for many commercial space ventures.
